project-challenges: Lighting for different types of game entities was handled differently, and they all had to be made uniform. Additionally, the screen is color-indexed, so logic behind the doom color indexes had to be painstakingly worked out.
project-purpose: Updates the screen pixels randomly, and only gives you distance as a brightness. The more noise you (or the monsters) make, the more pixels get updated (you can see better), but monsters are much more likely to notice you. Note that the 'v' key was mapped to a grunt, which is a good way to make on-demand noise.
project-inspiration: What if we only updated the screen randomly? Ooh, and what if you could only tell distance?
project-subtitle: Doom's too easy, because you can see. But what if you only had sonar? You'd probably die, but it'd be fun.
